# width

**Instance Property**

The width of the measurement unit.

## Declaration

```swift
var width: Measurement<UnitType>.FormatStyle.UnitWidth
```

## Discussion

The `width` property specifies the display of the measurement unit. The possible values are [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/UnitWidth/abbreviated], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/UnitWidth/narrow], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/UnitWidth/wide]. The format style represents the unit in the shortest notation available.

The following example shows *100 degrees Fahrenheit* in each width for the `en_US` locale.

```swift
let temperatureMeasurement = Measurement<UnitTemperature>(value: 100, unit: .fahrenheit)
temperatureMeasurement.formatted(.measurement(width: .wide)) // 100 degrees Fahrenheit
temperatureMeasurement.formatted(.measurement(width: .abbreviated)) // 100째F
temperatureMeasurement.formatted(.measurement(width: .narrow)) // 100째
```

## Modifying a measurement format style

- **Measurement.FormatStyle.UnitWidth**: Specifies the width of the unit, determining the textual representation.
- **numberFormatStyle**: The formatting of the measurement value.
- **usage**: The intended purpose of the formatted measurement.
- **hidesScaleName**: The visibility of the unit name of a temperature.
- **locale**: The locale of the format style.
